intro: Manihot anisitsii, commonly known as the Brazilian arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its tuberous roots, which are used as a starch source. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soils and ample sunlight. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy texture. The flowers are small and clustered, usually greenish-yellow, and are not particularly showy.
